note: Poverty data is expressed in [international-$](#dod:int_dollar_abbreviation) at 2017 prices. Depending on the country and year, it relates to income measured after taxes and benefits, or to consumption, [per capita](#dod:per-capita).
title: Share in poverty vs. life expectancy
subtitle: Poverty is measured as the share of the population living on less than $3.65 per day. Life expectancy is measured as the average number of years a newborn would live if age-specific mortality rates in the current year were to stay the same throughout its life.

display.name: Share of population below $3.65 per day
